item.title: Get antequated with SOmap
item.description: Polar maps! Last time we got this far by creating a very simplistic polar map and discussing some of the difficulties in customizing and finishing it. Since then Dale Maschette discussed these problems at useR Brisbane 2018 and stirred up multiple discussions on twitter about the joys of polar maps. Behold SOmap. SOmap::SOmap() ## Loading required namespace: rgeos SOmap To install the SOmap package use remotes::install_github("AustralianAntarcticDivision/SOmap") and see the package readme and documentation for further details.

item.title: hello-antequated
item.description: Welcome to Antequated.org We love maps. We love polar maps. We love the world as it is.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a blogdown website dedicated to producing maps nearer the poles. The antequated philosophy rails against the injustices of tropical-bias and rejects any notion of “up” or “down”, or indeed any kind of stability at all.

item.title: Making a general Southern Ocean map
item.description: Editorial note: This work is carried out using generally available R packages from CRAN. The content in this document was prepared before it was published, and in this form it may again be updated. There’s also a step where some CCAMLR polygons are read in from shapefiles that must be manually downloaded. In future we can remove this requirement and make things much easier.
